The World Health Organization's International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC) has classified processed meat as "carcinogenic to humans" (Group 1) based on sufficient evidence in humans that consuming processed meat causes colorectal cancer. The scientific consensus is that consuming processed meat increases colorectal cancer risk, and consuming red meat probably increases risk to a lesser degree.
